com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.metadata

Class Typer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.metadata.Typer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Typer.StandardTyper

    public class Typer
extends java.lang.Object
    The Typer class is used to infer data types from string inputs. It determines the types by trying a test specific to each data type sequentially on the input string. The tests used for each type are as follows:

    DataType Test (value is the string input)
    BOOLEAN value.equalsIgnoreCase("true") || value.equalsIgnoreCase("false")
    BYTE java.lang.Byte.parseByte(value) successfully executes
    SHORT java.lang.Short.parseShort(value) successfully executes
    INT java.lang.Integer.parseInt(value) successfully executes
    LONG java.lang.Long.parseLong(value) successfully executes
    FLOAT java.lang.Float.valueOf(value) successfully executes, and java.lang.Float.valueOf(value).toString().equals(java.lang.Float.valueOf(value)}.toString())}
    This test checks to see if any precision is lost when converting to a double versus a float.
    DOUBLE java.lang.Double.parseDouble(value) successfully executes
    STRING Default data type, always succeeds

    These tests can be changed by extending this class and overriding the appropriate testFor* methods. The order of the data types listed above is the order that the tests execute, until one succeeds. If none succeeds, the DataType.STRING type is selected. Also, if desired, the user can specify a subset of the data types available to select from when "typing" an input string. This class also contains methods to "type" an array of string data (organized as "rows"). Essentially, the methods checks as deep into the data as specified, and picks the appropriate data type for each "column."

    In addition to the type determination functionality, this class contains methods which will cast a string input into the appropriate object as defined by its inferred (or stated) type.

    Finally, for user convenience, a number of the class methods appear in static form.

    • Method Detail

      • inferType

        public DataType inferType(java.lang.String value,
                 java.util.Collection<DataType> includeTypes)
        Determine the data type for a given string input. The data types available to test the input against are specified as an argument. If the string cannot be matched to any of the available data types, then DataType.STRING will be returned (whether it is in includedTypes or not).
        Parameters:
        value - The string to infer a data type for.
        includeTypes - The types available to test value against.
        Returns:
        the data type that value matches to.

      • inferType

        public DataType inferType(java.lang.String value)
        Determine the data type for a given string input. All DataTypes are available for matching, with DataType.STRING being the default.
        Parameters:
        value - The string to infer a data type for.
        Returns:
        the data type that value matches to.

        Test whether the given string value can be represented by DataType.BYTE.
        Parameters:
        value - The string value to check.
        Returns:
        true if value can be represented as a byte, false otherwise.

      • inferTypesOnStringData

        public DataType[] inferTypesOnStringData(java.lang.String[][] data,
                                int maxDepth,
                                java.util.Collection<DataType> includeTypes)
        Infer data types for an array of data. The data is assumed to be like a "row-wise" table, with the first array dimension being rows, and the second dimension being columns. Each row up to the maximium specified depth is checked and the data types inferred for each column, which are then compared to the other rows already checked. For each column, the data type selected will be the one which can encompass all of the data values checked (e.g., if one value maps to a DataType.FLOAT and another maps to a DataType.DOUBLE, then DataType.DOUBLE is the type which can map them both).
        Parameters:
        data - The data whose types are to be inferred.
        maxDepth - The maximum depth to check into the data array.
        includeTypes - The data types to restrict the inferred types to.
        Returns:
        an array of data types, the order matching the order of the columns (2nd dimension) in data.

      • inferTypesOnRowData

        public DataType[] inferTypesOnRowData(java.lang.String[][] data,
                             int maxDepth)
        Infer data types for an array of data. The data is assumed to be like a "row-wise" table, with the first array dimension being rows, and the second dimension being columns. Each row up to the maximium specified depth is checked and the data types inferred for each column, which are then compared to the other rows already checked. For each column, the data type selected will be the one which can encompass all of the data values checked (e.g., if one value maps to a DataType.FLOAT and another maps to a DataType.DOUBLE, then DataType.DOUBLE is the type which can map them both). All data types are available for mapping in this method.
        Parameters:
        data - The data whose types are to be inferred.
        maxDepth - The maximum depth to check into the data array.
        Returns:
        an array of data types, the order matching the order of the columns (2nd dimension) in data.

      • inferTypesOnRowData

        public DataType[] inferTypesOnRowData(java.lang.String[][] data,
                             java.util.Collection<DataType> includeTypes)
        Infer data types for an array of data. The data is assumed to be like a "row-wise" table, with the first array dimension being rows, and the second dimension being columns. Each row in the table is checked and the data types inferred for each column, which are then compared to the other rows already checked. For each column, the data type selected will be the one which can encompass all of the data values checked (e.g., if one value maps to a DataType.FLOAT and another maps to a DataType.DOUBLE, then DataType.DOUBLE is the type which can map them both).
        Parameters:
        data - The data whose types are to be inferred.
        includeTypes - The data types to restrict the inferred types to.
        Returns:
        an array of data types, the order matching the order of the columns (2nd dimension) in data.

      • inferTypesOnStringData

        public DataType[] inferTypesOnStringData(java.lang.String[][] data)
        Infer data types for an array of data. The data is assumed to be like a "row-wise" table, with the first array dimension being rows, and the second dimension being columns. Each row in the table is checked and the data types inferred for each column, which are then compared to the other rows already checked. For each column, the data type selected will be the one which can encompass all of the data values checked (e.g., if one value maps to a DataType.FLOAT and another maps to a DataType.DOUBLE, then DataType.DOUBLE is the type which can map them both). All data types are available for mapping in this method.
        Parameters:
        data - The data whose types are to be inferred.
        Returns:
        an array of data types, the order matching the order of the columns (2nd dimension) in data.

      • castToType

        public java.lang.Object castToType(java.lang.String value,
                          DataType type)
        Cast (or parse) a string input into an object instance corresponding to a given data type. The returned object will be an instance of the class type.getObjectClass(). An exception will likely occur if the input string cannot be cast to the data type.
        Parameters:
        value - The string to be cast.
        type - The data type the string is to be cast to.
        Returns:
        value represented as an instance object corresponding to type.

      • castToType

        public java.lang.Object castToType(java.lang.String value)
        Cast (or parse) a string input into an object instance corresponding to an inferred data type. The returned object will be an instance of the class inferType(value).getObjectClass().
        Parameters:
        value - The string to be cast.
        Returns:
        value represented as an instance object corresponding to its inferred type.

      • coerceToType

        public java.lang.Object coerceToType(java.lang.String value,
                            DataType type)
        Coerce a given string input to the specified data type. This method is identical to castToType(String,DataType) except it will cast any numeric string to the specidied data type. Specifically, if 
             
         Number.class.isInstance(castToType(value)) == true
        then the appropriate [primitive]value() method will be called, where [primitive] is the primitive associated with type.
        Parameters:
        value - The string to be coerced.
        type - The data type the string is to be coerced to.
        Returns:
        value represented as an instance object corresponding to type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if value cannot be coerced into the specified type.

      • infer

        public static DataType infer(java.lang.String value,
             java.util.Collection<DataType> includeTypes)
        Determine the data type for a given string input. The data types available to test the input against are specified as an argument. This is just a static convenience wrapper for the instance method infer(String, java.util.Collection).
        Parameters:
        value - The string to infer a data type for.
        includeTypes - The types available to test value against.
        Returns:
        the data type that value matches to.

      • infer

        public static DataType infer(java.lang.String value)
        Determine the data type for a given string input. This is just a static convenience wrapper for the instance method inferType(String).
        Parameters:
        value - The string to infer a data type for.
        Returns:
        the data type that value matches to.

      • inferTypes

        public static DataType[] inferTypes(java.lang.String[][] data,
                    int maxDepth)
        Convenience method to infer data types for an array of data. This is just a static convenience wrapper for the instance method inferTypes(String[][], int).
        Parameters:
        data - The data whose types are to be inferred.
        maxDepth - The maximum depth to check into the data array.
        Returns:
        an array of data types, the order matching the order of the columns (2nd dimension) in data.

      • inferTypes

        public static DataType[] inferTypes(java.lang.String[][] data)
        Convenience method to infer data types for an array of data. This is just a static convenience wrapper for the instance method inferTypes(String[][]).
        Parameters:
        data - The data whose types are to be inferred.
        Returns:
        an array of data types, the order matching the order of the columns (2nd dimension) in data.

      • parse

        public static java.lang.Object parse(java.lang.String value,
                     DataType type)
        Parse a string input into an object instance corresponding to a given data type. This is just a static convenience wrapper for the instance method castToType(String, DataType).
        Parameters:
        value - The string to be cast.
        type - The data type the string is to be cast to.
        Returns:
        value represented as an instance object corresponding to type.

        Parameters:
